modules.description: This module manages text attributes in format strings, enabling dynamic control over visual properties like colors. It operates on string-based tags and supports enabling, disabling, and printing attributes. Concrete use cases include styling terminal output with ANSI colors or generating formatted documents where specific text segments require visual differentiation.

This module processes tagged format strings using S-expressions to define structured tags with attributes, supporting output modes like HTML, ANSI color, and block formatting. It works directly with format strings and formatter objects, enabling conditional rendering based on the active mode and attribute handling. The child module manages text attributes in format strings, enabling dynamic control over visual properties like colors, operating on string-based tags to support styling terminal output or generating formatted documents. Concrete use cases include generating HTML documents, colorizing terminal output, and structuring formatted text with tagged regions.
